questions.question: Wake vortex turbulence is correctly defined as:
options: the displaced air in the wake of the passage of an aircraft
the effect of the rotating air masses generated behind the wing tips of all aeroplanes
the efflux from jet engines and the wash from propellers
'dirty' air caused by the horizontal movement of an aeroplane through the atmosphere
questions.solution: the effect of the rotating air masses generated behind the wing tips of all aeroplanes

questions.question: Wake vortex turbulence is caused by:
options: the shape of the wing
differential speed of movement of air across the wing section
the interaction of the engine efflux/prop wash and the 'dirty' air from the wing
the disruption of airflow over a wing section when lift conditions exist
questions.solution: the disruption of airflow over a wing section when lift conditions exist

questions.question: Tip vortices are characterized by:
options: two counter-rotating cylindrical air masses trailing aft from the aeroplane
visible disturbances like 'streamers' trailing from wing tips
standing waves emanating from the wing area spaced according to the speed of the aeroplane
rotating disturbances of the air whilst the aeroplane is in the ground effect region
questions.solution: two counter-rotating cylindrical air masses trailing aft from the aeroplane

questions.question: Vortex generation begins ________ and ends ________
options: when the aeroplane moves / when the aeroplane stops
when lift is being generated / when lift generation stops
when the nose wheel lifts off / when the nose wheel touches down
when speed exceeds V1 / when speed is lower than VAT+10
questions.solution: when lift is being generated / when lift generation stops

questions.question: Which of the following describes the behaviour of vortices on the ground?
options: In the absence of crosswind, the vortices move downwards and outwards from the runway centre line at a speed of approx 5 kt
With a crosswind, the downwind vortex is stationary and the upwind vortex moves away from the centre line at approx 5 kt
With a crosswind, the upwind vortex is stationary and the downwind vortex moves towards the centre line at approx 5 kt
With a crosswind, both vortices move away from the centre line in the upwind direction at approx 5 kt
questions.solution: With a crosswind, the upwind vortex is stationary and the downwind vortex moves towards the centre line at approx 5 kt

questions.question: The strongest vortices are generated by:
options: heavy aeroplanes, travelling fast, in a 'clean' configuration
heavy aeroplanes, travelling fast, in a 'dirty' configuration
heavy aeroplanes, travelling slow, in a 'clean' configuration
heavy aeroplanes, travelling slow, in a 'dirty' configuration
questions.solution: heavy aeroplanes, travelling slow, in a 'clean' configuration

questions.question: Which of the following conditions is worst with regard to wake vortex turbulence?
options: Light winds near the surface
Strong winds near the surface
Marked vertical windshear
Marked atmospheric turbulence near the ground

questions.question: When comparing vortex generation between aeroplanes and helicopters:
options: aeroplanes generate more intense vortices per kg gross mass
a helicopter always generates more intense vortices because the diameter of the rotor is greater than a propeller
propeller aeroplanes generate more intense vortices than helicopters of the same gross mass
helicopters generate more intense vortices per kg gross mass than aeroplanes
questions.solution: helicopters generate more intense vortices per kg gross mass than aeroplanes

questions.question: ICAO categorizes aeroplanes with a max gross take-off mass of 138 000 kg as:
options: upper medium
medium
heavy
Cat D

questions.question: Where a medium category aeroplane is landing behind a heavy category aeroplane, the minimum separation distance in NM is:
Where a light category aeroplane is landing behind a heavy category aeroplane, the minimum separation distance in NM is:
Where a light category aeroplane is landing behind a medium category aeroplane, the minimum separation distance in NM is:
Where a light or medium category aeroplane is taking off behind a heavy category aeroplane on the same runway and from the same point, the minimum separation spacing in minutes is:

Where a light category aeroplane is taking off behind a medium category aeroplane on the same runway but the following aeroplane is departing from an intermediate point, the minimum separation spacing in minutes is:
Where parallel runway operations are being conducted and the runways are separated by 750 m:
options: the same wake turbulence separation criteria as single runway operations apply
the separation is reduced to 2 minutes
there is no need to apply separation
separation is only applied if the net flight paths from the parallel runways cross at a distance of not more than 5 NM from the departure end of either runway.
questions.solution: the same wake turbulence separation criteria as single runway operations apply

questions.question: Where parallel runway operations are in use and the projected flight path of the following aeroplane crosses that of the leading aeroplane at the same level or within 1000 ft lower:
options: the same wake turbulence separation criteria as single runway operations apply
the separation is reduced to 2 minutes
there is no need to apply separation
separation is only applied if the net flight paths from the parallel runways cross at a distance of not more than 5 NM from the departure end of either runway
questions.solution: the same wake turbulence separation criteria as single runway operations apply

questions.question: What is the minimum separation to be applied where a medium category aeroplane is about to take off after a heavy category aeroplane has made a missed approach in the opposite direction?
options: 1 minute
2 minutes
3 minutes
4 minutes

questions.question: The medium aeroplane taking off in Q17 is doing so on a parallel runway to the runway on which the heavy has just carried out the missed approach in the opposite direction. Is there any change in the separation standard applied?
options: No, providing the runways are less than 760 m apart
Yes, the separation is halved
Yes, they are changed to a separation distance
Yes, the separation is doubled
